properties.name: static-accepts
properties.description:
Which files are allowed by the framework for handling static files? Values in config files must be separated with the comma `,` (on one line).

__Default__:

```javascript
['.jpg', '.png', '.gif', '.ico', '.js', '.coffee', '.css', '.txt', '.xml', '.woff', '.otf', '.ttf', '.eot', '.svg', '.zip', '.rar', '.pdf', '.docx', '.xlsx', '.doc', '.xls', '.html', '.htm', '.appcache', '.map', '.ogg', '.mp4', '.mp3', '.webp', '.webm', '.swf', '.package', '.json', '.md']
```

__The config file declaration__:

```html
static-accepts            : .jpg, .ico, .js
```

properties.name: static-accepts-custom
properties.description:
This option adds all own values into `static-accepts` and it's not visible in `framework.config`. Values in config files must be separated with comma `,` (on one line). 

__The config file declaration__:

```html
static-accepts-custom        : .eps, .nosql
```

properties.name: default-ip
properties.description: The default IP address for listening of server.

properties.name: default-port
properties.description: The default PORT for listening of server.

properties.name: default-layout
properties.description: The default layout name for the views. The framework loads the layout in this format: `{directory-views}/{layout}.html`

properties.name: default-request-length
properties.description: The default request length in `kB` (kilobajt). The framework calculates POST/PUT data and length of uploaded files.

properties.name: default-websocket-request-length
properties.description: The default WebSocket message length in kB (kilobajt). The framework calculates received message.

properties.name: default-websocket-encodedecode
properties.description:
Encode/Decode WebSocket messages. The framework automatically encodes/decodes (through encodeURIComponent/decodeURIComponent) messages for better encoding. On client-side is needed creating encode/decode too.

Exmaple (client-side):
Sending: encodeURIComponent(JSON.stringify({ name: 'Peter Sirka' }));
Receiving: JSON.parse(decodeURIComponent(message))

properties.name: default-request-timeout
properties.description: The default request timeout in milliseconds (websocket doesn't support it).

properties.name: default-image-converter
properties.description: The default image/picture converter. Value: `gm` is GraphicsMagick and `im` is ImageMagick. Your server must have installed one of them.

properties.name: default-image-quality
properties.description: The default image/picture quality for JPEG files only.

properties.name: allow-handle-static-files
properties.description: Framework handles all static files if this option is true.

properties.name: allow-gzip
properties.description: Allows to use GZIP compression (for responses). GZIP is used when this option is true and browser supports compression.

properties.name: allow-websocket
properties.description: Allows the websocket listening. If you want to use e.g. Socket.io, this option must be false.

properties.name: allow-compile-js
properties.description: Allows to compile (compression) JavaScript files and inline scripts in views.

properties.name: allow-compile-css
properties.description: Allows to compile (compression, auto-vendor-prefixes) CSS files and inline styles in views.

properties.name: allow-compile-html
properties.description: Allows to compile (compression) HTML of views.

properties.name: allow-performance
properties.description: Allows to increase the HTTP performance.

properties.name: allow-custom-titles
properties.description: Disables to append an application name into meta tags.

properties.name: disable-strict-server-certificate-validation
properties.description: This option sets: process.env['NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED'] = 0

properties.name: default-interval-clear-resources

properties.name: default-interval-clear-cache

properties.name: mail.smtp.options
properties.description:
Mail settings for `framework.mail()` or `controller.mail()`: this option sets SMTP options:

- secure (optional, default: `false`)
- user (optional, default: empty)
- password (optional, default: empty)
- timeout (optional, default: `10000`)

Example:
```json
{"secure":false,"port":25,"user":"","password":"","timeout":10000}
```

api.name: FrameworkConfiguration
api.description:
`FrameworkConfiguration` contains the framework settings. Settings can be stored in these files:

```html
/app/config
/app/config-debug
/app/config-release
/app/config-rest
```

The `config` file is loaded for all framework modes (`release`, `debug`, `test`) and other configs are loaded according to the framework mode.

__Example__:

```html
name                     : My Web Site name
version                  : 1.01
author                   : Peter Sirka
secret                   : mySECRET1.01
default-image-quality    : 96
...
...
...
```

pages.name: Getting started
pages.body:
> Welcome to the **total.js documentation**. Total.js is free web application framework for building Web sites and Web applications using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. The framework has very simple logic, a short learning curve and many features for creating rich, scalable web applications.

## Installation options

I recommend download the framework with __empty project__:

- Install [node.js platform](http://www.nodejs.org) on your computer
- [Download empty project](https://github.com/totaljs/framework/releases)
- Unpack and run via terminal:

```bash
$ cd myapp
$ node debug.js
```

__Empty project__ contains 3x startup files `debug.js` (for development), `release.js` (for production) and `test.js` (for assertion testing). __IMPORTANT__: The startup file `debug.js` automatically watchs all changes in your project and after is created a change the script restarts the application automatically.

## Other ways for installation

### 1. NPM (Node package manager)

Node.js platform includes [Node package manager](http://www.npmjs.com) (NPM). This option install __total.js__ into current directory.

```bash
$ mkdir myapp
$ cd myapp
$ npm install total.js --save
```

### 2. NPM (Node package manager) installation as global module

If you install framework as global module you do not need to install framework to each web application. The global module contains executable (binary) file, this file contains many features (templates) for creating total.js applications.

```bash
$ npm sudo install -g total.js
```

__Try to write__ into terminal or command line after installation:

```bash
$ total -help
```

### 3. Run the framework without installation

Create `index.js` file, put below content into the file and run `node index.js`.

```javascript
function init() {

    framework.route('/', function() {
        this.plain('HOMEPAGE');
    });

    // debug (debug mode), release (release mode), test (test mode)
    framework.http('debug');
}

require('http').get('http://modules.totaljs.com/total.js/v1.7.0/total.js', function(res) {
    var buffer = [];
    res.on('data', function(buf) { buffer.push(buf.toString('utf8')); });
    res.on('end', function() { eval(buffer.join('')); if (typeof(init) !== 'undefined') init(); });
});
```

### Read more:

- [Total.js - Tutorial](#pages~Tutorial)
- [Total.js - Directory structure](#pages~Directory%20structure)

pages.name: Tutorial
Directory structure
pages.body:
> __Total.js__ project has a _simple directory structure_. All directories are optional and you can rewrite each path of directory in the framework configuration file.

## Directories

```markdown
controllers
databases
definitions
logs
models
modules
public
resources
source
packages
tests
tmp
views
workers
```

### Directory: controllers

Directory contains only controllers. In controller you can define routes with different actions. Controllers are __most important__ feature in the framework.

- [How do controllers work?](#pages~Controllers)

---

### Directory: databases

Directory contains __NoSQL embedded databases__ (if are). NoSQL database is a plain text file with serialized documents in JSON format. Some [3rd modules](https://github.com/totaljs/modules) store a small data in this directory.

- [How does NoSQL database work?](#pages~NoSQL)
- [Example: Database](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/contact-form)

---

### Directory: definitions

Directory contains all definitions. The definition defines behaviour of the framework. The definition is great for change a behaviour of e.g. modules.

- [How do definitions work?](#pages~Definitions)

---

### Directory: logs

Directory contains logs. Log file is plain text file. You can append a log message via `framework.log(message)` everywhere. Log filename is created by date.

- [Example: Logs](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/logs)

---

### Directory: models

Directory contains models. The model can contain functions or some [schemas](#api~Builders.SchemaBuilder). Recommended for database models.

- [How do models work?](#pages~Models)
- [Example: Models](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/models)

---

### Directory: modules

Directory contains extended modules. The module can create routes or can contain classes, functions or constants. You can download existing modules or you can create your own module.

- [How do modules work?](#pages~Modules)
- [Example: Modules](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/framework-modules)
- [Download 3rd modules](https://github.com/totaljs/modules)

---

### Directory: public

This directory is published directory and contains all static files (JavaScripts, CSS files, Pictures, Fonts, Documents, Videos, Uploads, etc.). Browser can get (almost) everything from the public directory.

---

### Directory: resources

If you create web pages that will be read by speakers of different languages, you must provide a way for readers to view the page in their own language. Resources are solution. The resource file has same syntax as a config file.

- [How do resources work?](#pages~Resources)
- [Example: Resources](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/localization-resources)

---

### Directory: source

This directory contains a business logic of your application. The source file can contain functions or objects which can be exported and used in each part of application.

- [Example: Source](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/framework-business-logic-source)

---

### Directory: packages

This directory contains packages. The package is a file which contains more files packed in one package file. The package behaves like a module (is same as module).

- [How do packages work?](#pages~Packages)

---

### Directory: tests

Test directory contains scripts for assertion testing. In assertion test you can test e.g. controller routing.

- [Example: Tests](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/assertion-testing)

---

### Directory: tmp

This directory is a temporary directory and contains temporary files. The framework stores some compiled files, internal cache and form uploads into this directory.

---

### Directory: views

This directory contains views and layouts.

---

### Directory: workers

This directory contains workers. The worker creates a new independent thread, which it can communicate with framework through events.

- [Example: Workers](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/workers)
- [Example: Generating sitemap with the Worker](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/xml-sitemap-workers)

Resources
pages.body: The resource file is the simple KEY/VALUE dictionary and you can store into it everything. Resources are simple and effective. On the resources is builded [localization](#pages~Localization). - The resource is the plain text file with `.resource` extension. - Framework loads each resource when is needed. - You can create unlimited count of resources. - Resources are readonly. - Resources are cached (in release mode) for 20 minutes. - Resources are used for validation. [Example](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/validation) ## Examples - [Example: Localization](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/localization-resources) - [Example: Schema validation](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/framework-schema-validation) - [Example: Validation](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/validation) - [Example: Custom validation](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/validation-custom) --- ## The definition ### resources/default.resource ```plain key1 : value1 // comment key2 : value2 key3 : with the tag ``` ### resources/en.resource ```plain key1 : value1-en // comment key2 : value2-en key3 : with the tag-en ``` ### resources/de.resource ```plain key1 : value1-de // comment key2 : value2-de key3 : with the tag-de ``` ## Reading values from resources - [Documentation: RESOURCE()](#api~global~RESOURCE) - [Documentation: framework.resource()](#api~Framework~framework.resource) - [Documentation: controller.resource()](#api~FrameworkController~controller.resource) ```javascript console.log(RESOURCE('key1')); console.log(framework.resource('key1')); // value1 console.log(RESOURCE('en', 'key1')); // value1-en console.log(RESOURCE('de', 'key1')); // value1-de ``` ### View engine ```html @{resource('key3')} @{!resource('key3')} @{resource('en', 'key3')} @{!resource('en', 'key3')} @{resource('de', 'key3')} @{!resource('de', 'key3')} ```

pages.name: View engine
pages.body:
`Views` can render HTML. You can render "view" in "view" and "view" is rendered into the layout at the end. The view engine supports conditions, loops, sections, helpers and inline helpers. --- __More informations__ - View is the plain HTML file with `.html` extension. - __IMPORTANT:__ Server tags are represented as `@{keyword}` (encoded) tag and `@{!keyword}` (raw) tag. - Views are synchronous. - Views are compiled into the function. - All views (HTML) are minimized under the compilation (total.js saves memory). - The layout is rendered at the last (if it's not disabled). - You can render some view into the string. - The char `~` maps the current path of the view into the views root directory - [View properties and methods](#api~FrameworkViews) --- ### Examples Most [examples](https://github.com/totaljs/examples) contain views. - [Example: Views](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views) - [Example: Views with XHR](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views-xhr) - [Example: Views places and sections](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views-place-sections) - [Example: Views meta](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views-meta) - [Example: Views inline JavaScript compress](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views-javascript-compress) - [Example: Views head](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views-head) - [Example: Views custom helper](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/views-custom-helper) --- ## Repository vs. Model Exist many ways how to send some values between controllers and views. You can transfer data between the controller and the view via `controller.repository` or `controller.view('name', model)`. ```javascript exports.install = function(framework, name) { framework.route('/', view_homepage); }; function view_homepage() { var self = this; self.repository.firstname = 'Peter'; self.view('my-view', { firstname: 'Lucia' }); } ``` A picture describes the behaviour of variables: ![Repository vs. model](resources/viewengine-repository-vs-model.png) ```html

My View

Get the value from the repository: @{repository.firstname}
Get the value from the model: @{model.firstname}
@{view('partial-view-1', model)}
@{view('partial-view-2')}
``` ## Defining the layout You can create unlimited layouts and customize them according to the name. The layout is same as the view but only one different is tag `@{body}`. Into this tag is rendered the view. ### The ayout example ```html @{meta} @{head} @{css('default.css')} @{js('default.js')} @{favicon('favicon.ico')}
@{section('panel')} @{body}
@{view('footer')} ``` Read more about [view engine tags](#api~FrameworkViews). --- ## Defining the view You can create unlimited views. ### Example ```html @{meta('Title', 'Description (optional)', 'Keywords (optional)')}
Hello World!
@{view('products', [{ name: 'A', price: 23.32 }, { name: 'B', price: 32.10 }])} @{view('users', model)} @{view('products', [{ name: 'A', price: 23.32 }, { name: 'B', price: 32.10 }, { name: 'C', price: 15.22 }])} ``` ## Escaping The view engine automatically escape HTML entities. Tag with `@{!` renders the raw value. ```html @{repository.tag = 'Hello World'}
ESCAPED: @{repository.tag}
RAW: @{!repository.tag}
``` __Output__: ```html
ESCAPED: Hello <b>World</b>
RAW: Hello World
``` ## Conditions ```html @{if user === null}
sign in
@{else}
sign up
@{endif}

@{if model.name === 'Peter'} @{if model.name === 'Lucia'}
Here is Lucia.
@{else}
Here is Peter.
@{endif} @{endif}

@{if model.name !== 'Peter'}
Here is @{model.name}
@{endif} ``` ## Looping ```html @{foreach m in [1, 2, 3, 4]}
@{m}, index: @{index}
@{end}

@{foreach property in model}
@{index}
@{property.name}
@{property.age.format('### ###')}
@{end} ``` ## Sections __View__: ```html @{section footer}
THIS IS FOOTER FROM THE VIEW
@{end}

Homepage


``` __Layout__: ```html .... .... @{body} .... .... @{section('footer')} .... .... ``` __Output__: ```html .... ....

Homepage


.... ....
THIS IS FOOTER FROM THE VIEW
.... .... ``` ## Assignment values __SUPPORTS ONLY:__ repository, model, user, session, global, get, post and config. ```html @{repository.name = 'Peter'}

@{repository.name}

``` __Output__: ```html

Peter

``` ## Defining helpers ```javascript framework.helpers.custom = function(str, num) { // this === controller return str + ' = ' + num; }; ``` ```html @{custom('Peter', 25)} ``` ## Defining inline helpers The inline helper must by defined in the view. ```html @{helper address(street, city)

Address

@{street}
@{city}

@{end}
Address 1
@{address('Baker street 3', 'Wien')}
Address 2
@{address('Galvaniho 3', 'Bratislava')} ``` ## Date feature `date` function compares the current date with date in the argument. ```html @{if date('>', '2015-01-01') && date('<', '2015-01-10 12:00')}
! Happy new year !
@{endif} @{viewToggle(date('=', '2014-08-08'), 'important-partial-view')} ``` ## Defining views in sub-directories The default controller `default.js` includes views from the default views directory `/views`. To modify this behaviour, rename the controller's filename (e.g: `controllers/site.js`) to match a directory of the same name under views (e.g: `views/site/`). The views contained within the `site` directory would be displayed. __IMPORTANT__: char `~` is very important for mapping path of views, because `~index` is still routed into the `/views/index.html`. --- ## Localization The framework automatically translates `@(text)` when compiling the views. - [How does localization work?](#pages~Localization) ```html @{meta('@(My custom title)', '@(Description to translate)')}

@(Hello world)

@(Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur ...)

``` ## Auto binding values ![Auto binding values](resources/viewengine-binding.png) __Controller__: ```javascript function view_contactform() { this.view('contactform', { Email: '@', Name: 'Anoym' }); }; ``` __View__: ```html Email: @{text('Email')} Name: @{text('Name')} ``` __Output__: ```html Email: Name: ``` --- [Download the syntax highlighter for Sublime Text 3](#pages~Developer%20tools)

pages.name: Localization
pages.body:
The localization is big tool for multilingual websites. - The framework translates views at time of compilation. - Each translated view is stored into the memory. - For generating translations is needed `total` (An executable file). - The text for translate is wrapped with `@()` tag (it will be a default text). - [Documentation: controller.translate()](#api~FrameworkController~controller.translate) - [Documentation: framework.translate()](#api~Framework~framework.translate) --- ## Full example ### First step You must install `total.js` as global module from NPM: ```bash $ sudo npm install -g total.js ``` ### Implementation The controller: ```javascript exports.install = function() { framework.route('/', view_index); }; function view_index() { var self = this; // Set the language according to the query parameter in URI: self.language = self.query.language || ''; // or accoding to the request header: Accept-Language // self.language = self.req.language; self.view('index'); } ``` The view: ```html @{meta('@(Title)')}

@(Hello world!)

@(total.js is web application framework for node.js)

``` ### Create resource __1.__ Open terminal or command-line: ```bash $ cd myapp $ total -translate ``` The Total Application finds all texts for translation and creates the resource file `translate.resource` for translation. The keys are numbers in the resource file because the framework saves the performance and memory (saves RAM). ```html // Total.js translation file // Created: 2014-12-18 10:32 // index.html T80818744 : Title T-52966915 : Hello world! T-1870230665 : total.js is web application framework for node.js ``` __2.__ I copy content from `translate.resource` to the new resource: `/resources/sk.resource` and I translate it, e.g.: ```html // Total.js translation file // Created: 2014-12-18 10:32 // index.html T80818744 : Titulok T-52966915 : Ahoj svet! T-1870230665 : total.js je webový framework pre node.js ``` ### Run `http://127.0.0.1:8000` ```html ... ... Title ... ...

Hello world!

total.js is web application framework for node.js

... ... ``` `http://127.0.0.1:8000/?language=sk` ```html ... ... Titulok ... ...

Ahoj svet!

total.js je webový framework pre node.js

... ... ```

pages.name: Authorization
Validation
HTML, JS, CSS
pages.body:
> total.js is doing the dirty job for you. Its core has implemented good tools to improve development and rendering web site for all web browsers.

## Release mode

- The framework sets reasonable HTTP cache for the static files (IMG, JS, CSS).
- The framework clears used resources in a time loop.
- The release mode returns highly rated content.

![Page speed](resources/html-pagespeed.png)

---

### HTML

- All comments are removed from the HTML.
- The HTML code is minified under compilation.

![HTML output](resources/html-sourcecode.gif)

---

### CSS

- All CSS code is minified `framework.config['allow-compile-css']`
- CSS supports - auto vendor prefixes - [Example: auto-vendor-prefixes](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/css-auto-vendor-prefixes).
- You can disable `auto-vendor-prefixes` - remove comment from the CSS: `/*auto*/`
- Inline styles in the HTML `<style type="text/css">`... are compiled and minified.
- You can rewrite built-in compilation - [SASS example](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/external-compile-sass).
- If the filename contains `.min` then it won't be compiled and minified.
- All minified styles are stored in `/tmp/` directory.

__CSS - Auto vendor prefixes__:

```css
/*auto*/

.animate { animation: myfirst 5s; }

@keyframes myfirst
{
    from { background: red; }
    to { background: yellow; }
}
```

__Output__:

```css
.animate{animation:myfirst 5s;-webkit-animation:myfirst 5s;-moz-animation:myfirst 5s;-o-animation:myfirst 5s;}@keyframes myfirst{from{background:red;}to{background:yellow;}}@-webkit-keyframes myfirst{from{background:red;}to{background:yellow;}}@-moz-keyframes myfirst{from{background:red;}to{background:yellow;}}@-o-keyframes myfirst{from{background:red;}to{background:yellow;}}
```

### JavaScript

- All JavaScript code is minified `framework.config['allow-compile-js']`
- Inline JavaScripts in the HTML `<script type="text/javascript">` ... are minified.
- You can rewrite built-in minification - [Example: Uglify](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/external-compile-uglifyjs).
- If the filename contains `.min` then it won't be minified.
- All minified scripts are stored in `/tmp/` directory.

```javascript
$(document).ready(function() {
    alert('WELCOME');
});
```

__Output__:

```javascript
$(document).ready(function(){alert('WELCOME');});
```

pages.name: Security (XSS, CSRF, CORS)
pages.body:
- The framework protects XSS automatically - [Cross-site scripting](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_scripting).
- Use AJAX/XHR form submitting for the [CSRF attacks](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery) protection
- The framework supports method for setting [CORS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-origin_resource_sharing).
- The framework supports auto-binding model into the forms.
- The framework automatically checks incoming requests and the bad requests destroys automatically.
- The framework checks length of uploading files.
- All requests are destroyed when don't have a defined route.

---

## Examples

- [Example: XSS protection](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/xss-protection)
- [Example: CSRF](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/csrf)
- [Example: CORS](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/cors)
- [Example: Auto binding values](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/forms)
